abstract: Has there ever been a candidate with such strong polling but such weak fundamentals? Almost certainly not.
snippet: Has there ever been a candidate with such strong polling but such weak fundamentals? Almost certainly not.
lead_paragraph: Herman Cain, the Georgia businessman who has never held elected office, is tied for the lead in national polls of Republican voters -- or perhaps even slightly ahead of Mitt Romney, as he was in Tuesday night's New York Times/CBS News poll. Mr. Cain has also led in most recent polls of the Iowa caucuses and the South Carolina primary, has taken the lead in Ohio, and is close to Mr. Romney in Florida. If all you had to go on was the polls, you might think that Mr. Cain was the favorite to win the Republican nomination.
